titleStmt.title: A witty combat, or, The female victor a trage-comedy : as it was acted by persons of quality in Whitson-week with great applause / written by T.P., Gent.
titleStmt.author: Porter, T. (Thomas), 1636-1680.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A55496 of text R9998 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing P2998). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 121 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 21 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1641-1700 ; 396:16)

titleStmt.title: A witty combat, or, The female victor a trage-comedy : as it was acted by persons of quality in Whitson-week with great applause / written by T.P., Gent.
titleStmt.author: Porter, T. (Thomas), 1636-1680.

notesStmt.note: About the adventuress Mary Moders, alias Carleton, who masqueraded as a "German princess."
Has been identified with the "German princess," a play produced in 1664. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Written by Thomas Porter. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Libraries.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: A Witty Combat, or The Female Victor
ep:epHeader.ep:defectRangePerGrade: This text has no known defects that were recorded as gap elements at the time of transcription.
